file_content.text: Jawas fix sandcrawlers, make trade now.
Go away. Jawas have no war droids, no sandcrawlers, nothing!
Tt. Jedi here! Bring tech parts, yes? Help Jawas rebuild sandcrawlers!
Give me the message and you'll get your parts.
We had a deal.
Of course.
Good. Good. Jawas rebuild sandcrawlers now, trade, survive.
Jedi is true friend of Jawas. Have message for desert-walker and also this--Jawa cloak. Jedi is Jawa now.
It's a little small, don't you think?
Will that even fit me?
Um. Is hood for Jedi?
A privilege. Thank you.
Jawas thank you, Jedi. Now we fix sandcrawler, make trade.
I don't want your stupid cloak. Just give me the message.
Keep your rag.
Tt. Jawa just trying to thank Jedi. Take message, leave Jawas alone.
I did your chore, now give me what I want.
Give me the message now.
Tt. Is not a friendly way to do trade. Here. Take message, leave Jawas alone.
Please, get sandcrawler parts for trade.
Stranger destroy Jawa war droid. Stranger is Jedi--too powerful for Jawa.
Why you come here? Make trouble? Other Jedi only come to make trouble for Jawas. Go away!
What can you tell me of this other Jedi?
Other Jedi?
Jawas call him Warmaker. He told us to take apart sandcrawlers. Build war machines for taking back Anchorhead, fighting Sand People.
If you didn't want trouble, you shouldn't have attacked me.
Your war droid shot first.
Not my idea. Other Jedi--Warmaker--his idea. Told Jawas take apart sandcrawlers. Build war machines for taking back Anchorhead, fighting Sand People.
I don't want to cause trouble. I just want to find Master Eriz.
I come in peace.
Yes. Other Jedi. Warmaker. He cause trouble. Made Jawas take apart sandcrawlers. Build war machines for taking back Anchorhead, fighting Sand People.
Then Warmaker leaves. Jawas now have war machines, but no sandcrawlers. No sandcrawlers means no trade. Jawas can't survive.
Why did Master Eriz instruct you to build war machines?
Why the droids?
I must know where he went.
Master Eriz left?
Jawas don't know. Jedi Warmaker says Jawas survivors, deserve to control desert.
But then Warmaker leaves Jawas. Worse off than before. No more sandcrawlers, and now you destroy war machines.
Warmaker left secret message for desert-walker friend. Jawas cannot understand it, but maybe desert-walker friend does.
Give me this message.
Let me see it.
Yes. Jawas give Jedi message, but maybe Jedi helps Jawas first?
I think I know this desert-walker.
You mean Rowan Delk.
Good. He can read message. But first maybe you help Jawas?
Who is this desert-walker?
Desert-walker?
Yes. Human called Rowan Delk. Walks the desert like the Jawas. He can read message. But first maybe you help Jawas?
Need sandcrawlers to trade, need trade to survive. We try to take parts from other sandcrawlers, but Geonosian bug-men stole them.
You're Jawa--isn't repairing things what you do?
Just fix the sandcrawlers.
We try to take parts from other sandcrawlers, but Geonosian bug-men stole them.
If Warmaker was here, he could take parts from bug-men, but Jawas aren't strong enough.
If I help you get your parts back, will you help me find the Warmaker?
Maybe we can make a deal.
Let me try.
Yes. Good. Help Jawas. Take tech parts from Geonosian bug-men so Jawas can fix sandcrawlers. Then Jawas give secret message for desert-walker.
Warmaker gave Jawas secret message for desert-walker friend Rowan Delk. Jawas give message if Jedi helps Jawas.
This is fair trade. Geonosian bug-men big and powerful, though--kill very many Jawas--so be careful.
Forget your sandcrawlers--I need to find Master Eriz.
I don't care about your fate.
Tt. Fine. Jawas have secret message for desert-walker friend of Warmaker. Human called Rowan Delk. Take message, then leave Jawas. Jedi no friend of Jawas.
Am sorry! Please don't hurt Jawa!
Help! Help! Help! Jawa no fight! Help!
